title: Fairfield PD: Suspected Western Hills Mall shooter in custody
content:
FAIRFIELD, AL (WBRC) -
The man accused of injuring a 5-year-old boy and another man in a shooting at Western Hills Mall is in custody, according to Fairfield Police Chief Leon Davis.
An arrest warrant was issued on Tuesday, charging Christopher DeAntwon Davis with attempted murder after police say he shot a 21-year-old man and grazed the boy in the neck at Western Hills Mall on last Friday.
His bond was set at $60,000.
Three others were also hurt in the incident.
Investigators believe that the 21-year-old was targeted following an altercation that happened earlier at the mall.
Police believe the suspect left the mall and returned with a gun. The 21-year-old is believed to have returned gunfire.
Chief Davis says a person separately showed up to the hospital with a non-life threatening gunshot wound. That person is a person of interest in this case.
Other charges are expected in connection with the shooting.
